lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Clanky.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Clanky.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

Clanky is a command-line interface chatbot that helps you manage your tasks efficiently. It supports adding different types of tasks, tracking their completion status, and provides search functionality to find tasks quickly.
Add a simple task without any deadline or time constraints.
A todo task will be added to your task list.
Add a task that needs to be completed by a specific date or time.
A deadline task will be added to your task list with the specified due date.
Add a task that occurs during a specific time period.
An event task will be added to your task list with the specified time range.
Display all your current tasks with their completion status.
All tasks in your list will be displayed with their index numbers.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Mark a task as completed by specifying its index number.
The specified task will be marked as done (shown with [X]).
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Mark a previously completed task as not done.
The specified task will be marked as not done (shown with [ ]).
Ok. I've marked this task as not done yet:
Remove a task from your list by specifying its index number.
The specified task will be removed from your task list.
Search for tasks containing a specific keyword in their description.
All tasks containing the keyword will be displayed with their original index numbers.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Exit Clanky and save your tasks automatically.
Your tasks will be saved and the application will close.
* Main class for the Clanky task management application.
* Clanky is a command-line interface chatbot that allows users to manage their tasks.
* It supports adding todos, deadlines, and events, as well as marking tasks as done/undone,
* listing tasks, and deleting tasks. Data persistence is handled automatically.
private static TaskList taskList = new TaskList();
private static Storage persMan = new Storage(taskList);
private static Ui ui = new Ui(BOT_NAME);
* Main entry point for the Clanky application.
* Initializes the application, loads existing data, runs the main command loop,
* Executes the main command processing loop.
* Continuously reads user input, parses commands, and handles exceptions.
* Loop continues until a bye command is received.
* Handles a single command from the user.
* Parses the command and executes the appropriate action (list, mark, unmark, delete, or add tasks).
* @param command The raw command string input by the user.
* @return Status code: 0 to continue, 1 to exit the application.
* @throws ClankyException If there is an error processing the command.
private static int handleCommand(String command) throws ClankyException {
* Handles adding a new task based on the parsed command.
* Creates the appropriate task type (ToDo, Deadline, or Event) and adds it to the task manager.
* @param parser The CommandParser containing the parsed command details.
* @throws ClankyException If required task details are missing or the command is invalid.
private static void handleAddTask(Parser parser) throws ClankyException {
* Parses user commands and extracts relevant information for task management.
* Supports parsing commands with flags like /by, /from, and /to for specifying
* due dates, start times, and end times respectively.
* Constructs a CommandParser with the given command string.
* @param command The raw command string to be parsed.
* Parses the command string and populates the action and detail fields.
* Recognizes context-switching flags (/by, /from, /to) and handles content appropriately.
* Handles switching the current parsing context based on flag tokens.
* Changes where subsequent content will be stored.
* @param newContextFlag The flag indicating the new context (/by, /from, or /to).
* Appends content to the appropriate field based on the current parsing context.
* Adds spaces between words when appending to existing content.
* @param newContent The content token to append to the current context field.
* Handles data persistence for the Clanky application.
* Manages loading tasks from and saving tasks to a file in the current directory.
* Uses the tasks.txt file for storage.
* Constructs a PersistenceManager associated with the given TaskManager.
* @param taskList The TaskManager instance to load data into and save data from.
* Gets the file path for the tasks storage file in the current directory.
* @return Path object pointing to the tasks.txt file.
* Loads task data from the storage file into the TaskManager.
* If the file doesn't exist, no tasks are loaded.
* Prints an error message if loading fails.
System.out.println("Error while loading data from " + filePath);
* Saves all tasks from the TaskManager to the storage file.
* Each task is written as a separate line using its string representation.
* Prints an error message if saving fails.
System.out.println("Error while storing data to " + filePath);
* Manages a collection of tasks for the Clanky application.
* Provides methods to add, remove, retrieve, and query tasks.
* Uses one-based indexing for user-friendly task numbering.
* Constructs a new TaskManager with an empty task list.
* Checks if the task list is empty.
* @return True if there are no tasks, false otherwise.
* Returns the number of tasks in the list.
* Returns the most recently added task.
* @return The latest task in the list.
* Returns the task at the specified one-based index.
* @param index The one-based index of the task to retrieve.
* @return The task at the specified position.
return tasks.get(index - 1);  // note that we use one-based indexing here
* Adds a new task to the end of the task list.
* @param task The task to add to the list.
* Removes the task at the specified one-based index.
* @param index The one-based index of the task to remove.
tasks.remove(index - 1);  // note that this is also one-based indexing
* Finds all tasks that contain the specified keyword in their description.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for in task descriptions.
* @return An ArrayList of tasks that match the search criteria.
* Finds all tasks that contain the specified keyword and returns them with their indices.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for in task descriptions.
* @return A formatted string with matching tasks and their indices.
* Handles all user interface interactions for the Clanky application.
* Manages input reading, output display, and error message formatting.
* Constructs a new Ui instance with the specified bot name.
* @param botName The name of the bot to display in messages.
* Displays the welcome message to the user.
showMessage("Hello! I'm " + botName + ".\n" + "What can I do for you?");
* Displays the goodbye message to the user.
* Reads and returns the next line of user input.
* Displays a message to the user with decorative separator lines.
* Displays an error message based on the type of exception.
showMessage("I don't understand you and it's your fault. Try again with a valid command.");
showMessage("That task does not exist. Learn to count before trying again.");
showMessage("You're missing some details. Add them before trying again.");
showMessage("You're missing your due date. Add your due date after a /by flag.");
showMessage("You're missing your start time. Add your start time after a /from flag.");
showMessage("You're missing your end time. Add your end time after a /to flag.");
showMessage("I have no idea what you did wrong, but you did something wrong.");
* Displays the list of tasks when no tasks exist.
* Displays the list of all tasks.
* @param taskList The formatted string containing all tasks.
* Displays a message when a task is marked as done.
* @param task The task that was marked as done.
showMessage("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n" + task);
* Displays a message when a task is marked as not done.
* @param task The task that was marked as not done.
showMessage("Ok. I've marked this task as not done yet:\n" + task);
* Displays a message when a task is deleted.
* @param task The task that was deleted.
showMessage("Can. I've removed this task:\n" + task);
* Displays a message when a task is added.
* @param task The task that was added.
* @param totalTasks The total number of tasks after adding.
public void showTaskAdded(String task, int totalTasks) {
showMessage("added: " + task + "\nNow you have " + totalTasks + " tasks.");
* Displays the results of a task search.
* Shows matching tasks with their original indices from the full task list.
* @param matchingTasks The formatted string containing matching tasks with indices.
showMessage("Here are the matching tasks in your list:\n" + matchingTasks);
* Base exception class for all Clanky application-specific exceptions.
* Serves as the parent class for all custom exceptions in the Clanky task management system.
* Exception thrown when a task command is missing required details.
* This occurs when users try to create a task without providing a description.
* Exception thrown when a deadline command is missing the required due date.
* This occurs when users try to create a deadline task without specifying the /by flag and due date.
* Exception thrown when an event command is missing the required end time.
* This occurs when users try to create an event task without specifying the /to flag and end time.
* Exception thrown when an event command is missing the required start time.
* This occurs when users try to create an event task without specifying the /from flag and start time.
* Exception thrown when attempting to operate on a task that doesn't exist.
* This occurs when users try to mark, unmark, or delete a task using an invalid task number.
* Exception thrown when an unrecognized or invalid command is entered.
* This occurs when users input commands that are not supported by the Clanky application.
* Represents a task with a deadline.
* Extends Task to include a due date that is displayed in the task representation.
* Constructs a new Deadline with empty description and due date.
* Constructs a new Deadline with the specified description and due date.
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param dueDate The due date for the task.
* Returns the type icon for Deadline tasks.
* @return "[D]" to indicate this is a Deadline task.
* Returns additional details showing the due date.
* @return A formatted string containing the due date in the format " (by: dueDate)".
* Represents a task that occurs during a specific time period.
* Extends Task to include start and end times that are displayed in the task representation.
* Constructs a new Event with empty description, start time, and end time.
* Constructs a new Event with the specified description, start time, and end time.
* @param description The description of the event task.
* @param startTime The start time of the event.
* @param endTime The end time of the event.
public Event(String description, String startTime, String endTime) {
* Returns the type icon for Event tasks.
* @return "[E]" to indicate this is an Event task.
* Returns additional details showing the start and end times.
* @return A formatted string containing the time range in the format " (from: startTime to: endTime)".
* Abstract base class representing a task in the Clanky application.
* All tasks have a description and a completion status, and can be displayed
* with type-specific icons and additional details.
* Constructs a new Task with empty description and not done status.
* Constructs a new Task with the specified description and not done status.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns the type-specific icon for this task.
* Must be implemented by subclasses to provide their unique identifier.
* @return A string representing the task type (e.g., "[T]", "[D]", "[E]").
* Returns the completion status icon for this task.
* @return "[X]" if the task is done, "[ ]" if not done.
return "[" + (isDone ? "X" : " ") + "]"; // mark done task with X
* Returns the description of this task.
* Returns additional details specific to the task type.
* Default implementation returns an empty string.
* Can be overridden by subclasses to provide type-specific information.
* @return Additional details to append to the task string representation.
* Returns the string representation of this task.
* Combines the type icon, status icon, description, and additional details.
* @return A formatted string representation of the task.
* Marks this task as not completed.
* Creates a Task object from its string representation.
* Parses the task type, completion status, description, and type-specific details.
* @param taskString The string representation of a task.
* @return A Task object of the appropriate subtype.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If the task type is not recognized.
String type = taskString.substring(0, 3); // First three characters represent [Type]
String descriptionEnd = taskString.contains(" (") ? taskString.substring(descStart, taskString.indexOf(" (")) : taskString.substring(descStart);
Event event = new Event(descriptionEnd, eventDetails[0], eventDetails[1]);
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Unknown task type: " + type);
* Represents a simple to-do task with just a description and completion status.
* Constructs a new ToDo with empty description.
* Constructs a new ToDo with the specified description.
* @param description The description of the to-do task.
* Returns the type icon for ToDo tasks.
* @return "[T]" to indicate this is a ToDo task.
todo find all books and read them
